intro: Malcolmia tadshikistanica, commonly known as the Tadshikistan mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
